title: Strengthening Patient Care Competencies in Practice: Open MOOC Design for Adults Tailored to Understanding Dementia

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Can explain dementia diagnosis and symptom management procedures by distinguishing at least three stages.
Identify at least three daily living challenges from the perspective of a dementia patient using VR simulation.

Learners can apply the five core principles of Andragogy (self-directedness, experience-based learning, etc.) to set at least three specific monthly learning goals over a six-month course, complete over 80% of weekly learning journals (including time investment, resource utilization, performance evaluation), and submit a self-assessment report (learning achievements, areas for improvement, future plans) at the course’s conclusion.
Analyze current research trends in dementia and propose two practical strategies for application in clinical practice.
Design at least one family support plan for dementia patients through small-group collaborative learning.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
